abstract: BEA Systems, an Oracle rival in the market for corporate software known as middleware, is being pressured to sell by its largest shareholder, the investor Carl C. Icahn.
snippet: BEA Systems, an Oracle rival in the market for corporate software known as middleware, is being pressured to sell by its largest shareholder, the investor Carl C. Icahn.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 12 — The Oracle Corporation, the business software maker, said on Friday that it had made an unsolicited bid to acquire a rival, BEA Systems, for $6.7 billion, an offer that BEA executives rejected as too low.

headline.main: Oracle Bids $6.7 Billion for Rival BEA, Whose Officers Say It’s Worth More
headline.print_headline: Oracle Bids $6.7 Billion for Rival BEA, Whose Officers Say It’s Worth More
